Authors: Shuji Ushijima, Nitaro Maekawa, Kozue Sotome
Title:
A new species of the genus Tubulicium collected from living
Pieris japonica.
Abstract:
Tubulicium curvisporum sp. nov., belonging to the family
Hydnodontaceae (Trechisporales) is frequently grow on a living tree of
Pieris japonica in Japan, and is characterized by white resupinate,
hispidurous basidiomata producing sickle-shaped, strong curved
basidiospores measuring 16.525.5 × 4.77 µm. For identification of this
species, morphological descriptions and illustrations, cultural
characters and key to species of this genus are provided here.
